00001 /**
00002  * \file MPFRExponentialL.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for MPFRExponentialL
00004  *
00005  * Sampling exactly from the exponential distribution for MPFR using the
00006  * traditional method.
00007  *
00008  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2012) <charles@karney.com> and licensed under
00009  * the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00010  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00011  **********************************************************************/
00012 
00013 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_MPFREXPONENTIALL_HPP)
00014 #define RANDOMLIB_MPFREXPONENTIALL_HPP \
00015   "$Id: a6ca899faa2b27b3f6b69b61fd9874e3fc428fd7 $"
00016 
00017 #include <cmath>                // for log
00018 #include <mpfr.h>
00019 
00020 namespace RandomLib {
00021 
00022   /**
00023    * \brief The exponential distribution for MPFR (the log method).
00024    *
00025    * This class is <b>DEPRECATED</b>.  It is included for illustrative purposes
00026    * only.  The MPFRExponential class provides a much more efficient method for
00027    * sampling from the exponential distribution.
00028    *
00029    * This is an adaption of ExponentialDistribution to MPFR.  The changes are
00030    * - Use MPFR's random number generator
00031    * - Use sufficient precision internally to ensure that a correctly rounded
00032    *   result is returned.
00033    *
00034    * This class uses mutable private objects.  So a single MPFRExponentialL
00035    * object cannot safely be used by multiple threads.  In a multi-processing
00036    * environment, each thread should use a thread-specific MPFRExponentialL
00037    * object.
00038    **********************************************************************/
00039   class MPFRExponentialL {
00040   private:
00041     // The number of bits of randomness to add at a time.
00042     static const long chunk_ = 32;
00043 
00044   public:
00045     /**
00046      * Initialize the MPFRExponentialL object.
00047      **********************************************************************/
00048     MPFRExponentialL() {
00049       mpz_init(_vi);
00050       mpfr_init2(_eps, chunk_);
00051       mpfr_init2(_v1, chunk_);
00052       mpfr_init2(_v2, chunk_);
00053     }
00054     /**
00055      * Destroy the MPFRExponentialL object.
00056      **********************************************************************/
00057     ~MPFRExponentialL() {
00058       mpfr_clear(_v2);
00059       mpfr_clear(_v1);
00060       mpfr_clear(_eps);
00061       mpz_clear(_vi);
00062     }
00063     /**
00064      * Sample from the exponential distribution with mean 1.
00065      *
00066      * @param[out] val the sample from the exponential distribution
00067      * @param[in,out] r a GMP random generator.
00068      * @param[in] round the rounding direction.
00069      * @return the MPFR ternary result (+1/-1 if val is larger/smaller than the
00070      *   exact sample).
00071      **********************************************************************/
00072     int operator()(mpfr_t val, gmp_randstate_t r, mpfr_rnd_t round) const {
00073       
00074       mpfr_prec_t prec0 = mpfr_get_prec (val);
00075       mpfr_prec_t prec = prec0 + 10; // A rough optimum
00076       mpz_urandomb(_vi, r, prec);
00077       mpfr_set_ui_2exp(_eps, 1u, -prec, MPFR_RNDN);
00078       mpfr_set_prec(_v1, prec);
00079       mpfr_set_z_2exp(_v1, _vi, -prec, MPFR_RNDN);
00080       mpfr_set_prec(_v2, prec);
00081       mpfr_add(_v2, _v1, _eps, MPFR_RNDN);
00082       while (true) {
00083         int f2 = mpfr_log(val, _v2, round); // val = log(upper bound)
00084         mpfr_set_prec(_v2, prec0);
00085         int f1 = mpfr_log(_v2, _v1, round); // v2 = log(lower bound)
00086         if (f1 == f2 && mpfr_equal_p(val, _v2)) {
00087           mpfr_neg(val, val, MPFR_RNDN);
00088           return -f1;
00089         }
00090         prec = Refine(r, prec);
00091       }
00092     }
00093   private:
00094     // disable copy constructor and assignment operator
00095     MPFRExponentialL(const MPFRExponentialL&);
00096     MPFRExponentialL& operator=(const MPFRExponentialL&);
00097     // Refine the random interval
00098     mpfr_prec_t Refine(gmp_randstate_t r, mpfr_prec_t prec)
00099       const {
00100       prec += chunk_;
00101       mpfr_div_2ui(_eps, _eps, chunk_, MPFR_RNDN);
00102       mpz_urandomb(_vi, r, chunk_);
00103       mpfr_set_prec(_v2, prec);
00104       mpfr_set_z_2exp(_v2, _vi, -prec, MPFR_RNDN);
00105       mpfr_add(_v2, _v1, _v2, MPFR_RNDN);
00106       mpfr_swap(_v1, _v2);      // v1 = v2;
00107       mpfr_set_prec(_v2, prec);
00108       mpfr_add(_v2, _v1, _eps, MPFR_RNDN);
00109       return prec;
00110     }
00111     mutable mpz_t _vi;
00112     mutable mpfr_t _eps;
00113     mutable mpfr_t _v1;
00114     mutable mpfr_t _v2;
00115   };
00116 
00117 } // namespace RandomLib
00118 
00119 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_MPFREXPONENTIALL_HPP
